title: Vintage Toy Trucks & Vehicles
description: From Tonka dump trucks to Matchbox cars, test your knowledge of the toy vehicles that rumbled across playroom floors!

questions.question: Tonka trucks got their reputation for toughness because they were made from what material?
The first Tonka toy produced in 1947 was not actually a truck. What was it?
Matchbox cars got their name because the original cars were sold in boxes resembling what?
In what country were Matchbox cars originally manufactured?
The Buddy L toy company was named after the son of the founder. What were Buddy L trucks originally made from?
options: Pressed steel from leftover factory materials

questions.question: What was the most popular Tonka truck model, featuring a working dump bed that could be raised and lowered?
Corgi Toys, a competitor to Matchbox, was the first die-cast toy car company to include what feature?
What innovative feature distinguished Hot Wheels cars from Matchbox cars when they were introduced in 1968?
options: They had low-friction wheels that rolled faster

questions.question: The Structo toy company was known for making realistic toy trucks. Where were they manufactured?
What type of Tonka truck included a working aerial ladder that could be raised and extended?
Smith-Miller toy trucks, known as 'Smitty Toys,' were prized for their realism. They were modeled after what brand of real trucks?
What play surface did many children create in the backyard for their toy trucks and construction vehicles?
Nylint toy trucks, popular from the 1950s through 1970s, were known for featuring what type of construction?
options: Pressed steel with realistic mechanical features

questions.question: What Tonka vehicle set included a truck, trailer, and bulldozer combination?
In the 1960s, what Tonka truck was designed for sandbox play with a working scoop on the front?
